STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
August 24, 2023
Donata Kidd
MUSKEGON COUNTY DHHS
2700 BAKER ST,
MUSKEGON HEIGHTS, MI, 49444-2157
RE: License#: CP610201318
Dear Donata Kidd:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on August 24, 2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Donata MARIE Kidd
Name of Agency: MUSKEGON COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 2700 BAKER ST
MUSKEGON HEIGHTS, MI 49444-2157
Agency Telephone #: 2317333700
Original Issuance Date: 03/01/1992
Service Types: Place children for adoption, Certify foster
homes for license, Supervise Independent
Living, Place children in foster home,
Evaluate Applicants for adoption

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid from
the American Heart Association or the American Red Cross or
other institution approved by the department.
One of six foster home files reviewed did not have current certification in CPR/First Aid
as required.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report.
One of five special investigations reviewed did not have a report completed within 15 days
of the conclusion of the evaluation.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(a) Provide the foster parent with a copy of the report required
by subrule (5) of this rule within 10 calendar days of its
completion.

One of five special investigations reviewed did not contain documentation the foster
parent was provided a copy of the report within 10 calendar days of completion as
required.
R. 400.12417 Foster parent information
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement of a
child:
(a) Child's name.
(b) Child's date of birth.
(c) Available known information about the child's health.
(d) Any known history of abuse or neglect of the child.
(e) All known emotional and psychological factors relating to
the care of the child.
(f) All known behaviors of the child.
(g) Circumstances necessitating placement or replacement of
the child.
(h) Any other known information to enable the foster parent to
provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including information about siblings
who do not reside in the foster home.
Two of eight open foster care case files reviewed did not contain documentation that all
information required within subsection a-h of this rule was provided to the caregivers
within the timeframes outlined within the rule.
R 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health care as
required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental, and mental health
care provided shall be documented in the youth’s record.
One of three independent living files did not have documentation the youth had a current
physical examination.
FOM 722-08C Foster Care-Parent Agency Treatment Plan & Service
Agreement
When completed, obtain all signatures as appropriate,
including those of parent(s)/guardian(s), foster care worker,
supervisor, foster parent, caregiver, any youth aged 14 and

older and in the case of placement agency foster care cases,
the local DHS office designee.
Three of eight foster care files reviewed, and two of three independent living files reviewed
(6 of 45 service plans) did not contain all of the required signatures on the parent agency
treatment plan (PATP).
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8/11/2022 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/6/2022
9/2/2021 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/29/2021
FOM 722-08 Supervisor approval
The supervisor must approve all case service plans within 14
days as required.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have supervisory approval of the case
service plan within 14 days as required.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8/11/2022 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/6/2022
FOM 722-06H Contact with supervisor
The caseworker must meet with their supervisor at least
monthly for case consultation on every assigned case.
One of eight foster care files reviewed did not have documented monthly supervision with
staff as required.
FOM 722-06B FTM Documentation
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in MiSACWIS
using the FTM hyperlink within seven business days of the
FTM.
Four of eight foster care files reviewed contained FTM’s/semi-annual meetings without
the DHS 1105/DHS 901, or the DHS 1105/DHS 901 was not uploaded within seven
business days.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8/11/2022 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/6/2022
9/2/2021 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/29/2021

FOM 801-03 Medical passports
For children entering foster care, the initial medical
passport must be provided within two weeks of the child's
placement date to the following:
• Foster care provider.
• Young adult voluntary foster care (YAVFC) youth/young
adult re-entering foster care.
The actual date the medical passport is provided must be
documented in the electronic case management record.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Participating legal parents, if the child is a temporary court
ward.
Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement.
At reunification. Subsequent medical passports are not
required after reunification.
• The child’s foster care provider:
At or prior to each placement.
• All medical and mental health professionals to whom the
child is newly referred to and accepted for treatment and/or
services prior to or at the first scheduled appointment while
the foster care case is open, regardless of placement.
Subsequent medical passports are not required.
• • Older youth/young adults:
• Upon initial independent living placement (youth age 16
and over).
• Upon exiting the foster care system (young adults age 18
and older).
• Young adult voluntary foster care (YAVFC) youth/young
adult:
• Within two weeks of re-entry into voluntary foster care.
• Upon exiting voluntary foster care.
Two of eight foster care files reviewed did not have medical passports and required
signatures.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
8/11/2022 INTERIM, CAP approved 10/6/2022
9/2/2021 RENEWAL, CAP approved 9/29/2021
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Ensure address on IL contracts is entered.

• Enter separate social work contacts for sibling visits.
• Upload documents in the correct location.
• If SOP was impacted due to a system issue, make sure to upload Help Desk
ticket information.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The facility did not request or require consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows. The
agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan in response to the interim
inspection completed on 8/11/2022 with a corrective action plan approved on
10/6/2022. During the review the agency had eight violations. Four citations were
noted as repeat violations in the current inspection. During this period under
review the agency noted that compliance was impacted, in part, by noncompliant
parents.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency's efforts in meeting licensing requirements
during this review period. The Chief Administrator (CA) stated the agency has
experienced noncompliant parents that have impacted overall compliance, in part,
as it related to PATP signatures, worker/parent visits and parent/child visits.
The CA indicated the agency has continued to utilize additional internal methods
to ensure compliance. The CA also noted staff have taken a more active role in
creating the CAP which has ensured whole program buy in and successful
implementation. CA expressed confidence that the agency will continue to see
improvement over the next review period.
Financial Overview
NA
Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with three staff via telephone. Staff report feeling
supported by supervision as well as coworkers. There were no concerns reported.

Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care and licensing services. All files were stored securely.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
________8/24/2023_____________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
August 24, 2023

Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
